definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(old) jade tablet (a ceremonial badge of rank)
lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
to suspend/to hang/(vehicle) suspension
to worry about/to be concerned about
lit. to hang upside down/fig. topsy-turvy and inequitable, e.g. manufacturing and trading costs exceed the sale price (of some goods)/to borrow more than one can ever repay
to hang up (a phone)
to register (at a hospital etc)/to send by registered mail
to be affiliated with/to operate under the wing of/affiliation
temporary assignment to a Chinese government or CCP post
to report the loss of something
to be in command/(fig.) to dominate over other considerations/to be given overemphasis
wall calendar
trailer
concerned
not wearing one thread (idiom); absolutely naked/without a stitch of clothing/in one's birthday suit
wall hanging

sentences.english: The big plaster-walled living room held six framed photographs.
sentences.chinese: 客厅的板墙上挂着六个相框。

sentences.english: Jiao body red drapery Cui lid, up put Long Feng to show lucky omen, four the angles hang silk Sui.
sentences.chinese: 轿身红幔翠盖，上面插龙凤呈祥，四角挂着丝穗。

sentences.english: The picture was hung on the line.
sentences.chinese: 在墙上显眼的地方挂着一幅画。

sentences.english: A full moon hung in the sky on Mid-autumn Day.
sentences.chinese: 中秋那天，一轮圆月挂在天空。

sentences.english: The printing part adopts hanging plate roller, which could shorten the time of plate lock-up.
sentences.chinese: 印刷部采用挂版式版辊，可缩短装版时间。

sentences.english: Red and bright, hanging in the sky.
A large-scdraugustht beer painting! usuficnearlyy on a wa certainy ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 一样平常挂在墙上或天花板上的巨幅画。

sentences.english: And nine red balloons hanging on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 墙上还挂着九个红气球。

sentences.english: A large-scale painting, usually on a wall or ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 一般挂正在墙上或天花板上的巨幅画。

sentences.english: In peripheral equipment sticked hang "homework manipulate guidance".
sentences.chinese: 在周边设备上贴挂“功课操纵指引”。

sentences.english: Marius' two arms were passed round his neck, and the former's feet dragged behind him.
sentences.chinese: 马吕斯的双臂围着他的脖子，双足在他后面挂着。

sentences.english: Crosswalks even got a fresh coat of paint to encourage walking and biking.
sentences.chinese: 过街天桥上都挂上鼓励步行和骑车的条幅。

sentences.english: Straw patchwork with Chinese word "Tea". Hang it on the wall of livingroom to show artistic culture.
sentences.chinese: 麦秆画茶，适合挂在客厅，显示主人的艺术。

sentences.english: The seed-heads should be hung up to dry.
sentences.chinese: 应该把那些种子穗挂起来晒干。

sentences.english: He hammered a tack into the wall and hung the picture from it.
sentences.chinese: 他把一个大头钉敲进了墙，并且在上面挂了一幅画。

sentences.english: It is a funky restaurant with very interesting art on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 那是一家墙上挂着很成心思的绘画的新潮餐馆。

variant of 錘|锤[chui2]
trumpet/small size (clothes etc)/(coll.) number one/to urinate/(humble) our store
to reopen/to start again
to be wounded/(of plants) to bloom
